Apache Submarine Server REST API

Overview

Apache Submarine provides several REST APIs for interaction and remote activation of zeppelin functionality. All REST APIs are available starting with the following endpoint http://[zeppelin-server]:[zeppelin-port]/api. Note that Apache Submarine REST APIs receive or return JSON objects, it is recommended for you to install some JSON viewers such as JSONView.

If you work with Apache Submarine and find a need for an additional REST API, please file an issue or send us an email.

Zeppelin Server REST API list

Get Zeppelin version

Description This GET method returns Zeppelin version
URL http://[zeppelin-server]:[zeppelin-port]/api/version
Success code 200
Fail code 500
sample JSON response 
{
  "status": "OK",
  "message": "Zeppelin version",
  "body": [
    {
      "version": "0.8.0",
      "git-commit-id": "abc0123",
      "git-timestamp": "2017-01-02 03:04:05"
    }
  ]
}

Change the log level of Zeppelin Server

Description This PUT method is used to update the root logger's log level of the server.
URL http://[zeppelin-server]:[zeppelin-port]/api/log/level/<LOG_LEVEL>
Success code 200
Fail code 406
sample JSON response 
{
  "status": "OK"
}
sample error JSON response 
{
  "status":"NOT_ACCEPTABLE",
  "message":"Please check LOG level specified. Valid values: DEBUG, ERROR, FATAL, INFO, TRACE, WARN"
}
